reviews.sentence: Simple Perfection. A lovely well designed with superb landscape architecture boutique hotel escape. Thanks again to the most wonderful staff who made our stay extra special. Delicious culinary cuisine with staffs special attention to detail. Resort Fee well worth the miles pedaled on cruiser bikes down to Marina del Rey not to mention the yoga on the beach. Three days of pure bliss.

Staff really helpful Perfect location Nice and confortable hotel. Stairs to get through the rom not easy with suitcase No signs to show the room agencement per floor Lack of plug by the bed side No tea in bedroom only coffee. no free water.
Perfect place for ones honeymoon. 2 minutes walk to the beach.

Lovely community feeling. Beautiful place with special energy. Staff was very helpful. Pool and surrounding area lovely. Onsite breakfast option was quality. Great location without feeling surrounded by too many other people.

Our stay in Santa Monica. The staff was wonderful the pool lovely and the location was fantastic. The food was excellent. We especially enjoyed using the facilities bikes to ride around the area. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The walls must be thin because we could hear a lot from the room next to us and above us.
amazing. it was amazing experience evreything was perfectnothing.
Luxury but warm atmosphere. Very nice hotel with very friendly staff excellent atmosphere and very nice pool inner of the hotel. Excellent breakfast. Lovely place.
Beautifully designed west coast vibes and flavors.

Great locale beautiful and clean. Just get your booking facilities double checked. Inspite of booking well in advance and for 3 nights we were allotted arom in the extreme corner. Although we asked for a better room wewere in the us for the first time we were not accommodated at all. Left a slight bad taste. However overl the hotel was fantastic. I amtrying to figure out that the bad room location was due to my bokingthru bokingcom and maybe if I had booked directly I would have got abetter room.

Comfortable Boutique living at the best part of Santa Monica. The property is perfectly located on Ocean Blvd In Santa Monica. Just in front of a pathway down to the beach. It is also in the northern part of Santa Monica so it is in a quiet area but still on 3 blocks from the Promenade and the center of attractions. The staff has been kind and courteous. The room we stayed at lanai suite was spacious and comfortable. I like that they have Nespreso coffee machines in the room and not the standard filtered coffee machines you had usually find in other hotel roms The bathtub itself was kind of old and clunky. Not easy to use. Pricey.

Terrible night shouting and screaming. At night between 3 30am to 40am there was extremely loud shouting and screaming from the pool area that is surrounded by bedrooms. Finally I had no option but to call the night reception to insist that they take action to control the totally unacceptable disturbance that was taking place. In response to my complaint the night staff attempts to claim the shouting had just commenced was insulting to me and indicative of disinterest or or defensiveness. Following my call the shouting finally ceased. I shal never stay at this hotel again.

HIGHLY recommended this property. Preferred this specific location over other high end hotels. Fantastic property. We only wished we realized how nice this hotel was prior to booking since we would have stayed here for the entirety of our trip. The staff upgraded our room on check in to a beautifully renovated suite. The hotel itself is in a perfect location steps from the beach and all the Santa Monica action. Extremely easy to find parking and superb neighborhood. Will DEFINITELY stay with you all again if we are in the area. Thanks for an amazing stayN A.
Fantastic Once Again. Staff. Breakfast ChargesCar park cost.

Had a nice time but felt that it was a little pricey. Within walking distance to the beach. Excellent valet service. Efficient maid service. Rooms are not soundproofed. Had an hour long wait on our last night for dinner problems in the kitchen they gave us free dessert to compensate. Overpriced in general food and accommodation. Pool loungers fill up fast. Sun disappears relatively early in the afternoon evening only shines on one part of the pool so it can get cold. Our room was an adjoining room so we asked to change. Management did offer us another room but due to a breakdown in communication the room was already taken. Given what we paid I did not expect to be given an adjoining room. Unfortunately we could hear the people next door talking their TV etc. Management did accommodate our request for a top floor room however. Just a pity it was an adjoining one otherwise I think we would have been more than happy.

Very good hotel in peaceful location. Ocean view. Friendly stuff. Peaceful location. Great bartenders serving drinks in the evening near the polAwful in room dining. Ordered pasta with meatballs worse meatballs ever. Choice of food in the late evening for in room dinning very poor only 4 to choose fromThere was some machine AC or sth similiar that was turning on and off every hour few times making it very annoying during the night. Felt like the room was shaking a bit and noise was disturbing falling a sleep. Not significant flaw but if you are delicate like me then choose difrent room I stayed in top ocean viewSauna in the elevator elevator was the hottest room in the hotel with very poor air flow. if anyOveral very good hotel with wonderful location.
Lovely boutique hotel for families. The staff was wonderful. They were so nice and helpful. My kids had a great time in the pool. They were asking when we could come back before we even left.

Wonderful Hotel with only one drawback. This hotel was great. The beds were comfortable and the suite had plenty of room. The location and the free bikes were convenient. Everyone on staff was extremely courteous and attentive to offering water for our bike ride adjusting my kids ’ bikes and quickly fixing a hot water issue. The only negative is that you can hear people in other rooms.

Noise. I was very turned off by the paper thin walls windows and floors consistently hearing plumbing sounds and neighbors walking and talking in the room above me traffic all night long lawn work out in the street was as loud as if the windows were open and started at 8 am. Also this hotel has the “ mushy pillow ” problem. On the good side the heated pool seems nice but closes at 8 pm cleanliness was high bathrooms were nice and the in and out valet is convenient. Staff was incredibly kind and responsive but nothing they can do about the noise problems. Because some of the rooms are rather large with a “ suite ” living room in front this might be a good choice for families with small children. I would not stay here again despite the nicely appointed rooms because it was not restful sleep.

weekend paradise. We have stayed at the Oceana numerous times in the past 15 years. We have always found the staff extra friendly and helpful. Food is excellent but remember when breakfast was included in the room rate. It is always quiet and restful and the pool adds an extra bonus. Recent trip was not an exception and we will be back.

Excellent. I love that this was a more idyllic location and not a big chain hotel with too many people jostling for pool position. The food and drinks were great from the onsite guest only restaurant. We had a hiccup on arrival after a long haul flight the room we were given did n’t have any seating just a large space where a couch and coffee table should have been. We checked with reception and they said the furniture had been damaged. Fortunately they were able to move us to another room which was unfortunately larger disappointingly they charged us extra although we believe it should have been at their cost due to the incomplete room that we were initially checked in to. After a long haul flight we were n’t going to argue. That aside the new room was very comfortable especially the super sized bed. Once we settled in we really enjoyed our stay here. The free bikes were great for getting around especially as it is a 15 minute walk to the pier and shopping in 3rd ave. Fabulous boutique small hotel we would stay here again. Until next time LA.
Elevator broken No ramp to building Valet parking only. Otherwise a great experience.

We were disappointed our room had a balcony. the restaurant inside the hotel was ok. overall the staff was friendly and answered all requests. I booked the the room with one king size bed. it was our honeymoon and I wrote about it in the comments on booking com when I booked this hotel. We came in the evening by car and the Valet parking costs was 50 although it is free across the street. We overpaid around 130 per 2 nights and breakfast was not included. for a stinky room with a view of the wall and two different beds. I asked change this awful room and we were said to pay in addition 50. of course we paid it. no normal bathroom looks like a pit for shower. The room has a Nespreso coffee machine but bring the capsules with you because we were given all the crumpled capsules to such an extent that none of them could even fit in the hole. It looks like a poorly made art hotel. We stay only in five stars hotel and the Ocean beach club hotel is three stars maximum.

They do not like money and the customer service is ALMOST non existent. You know the type of businesses that do not look at or respond to reviews. Take a look this company does not respond or acknowledge reviews. That tells you something. Pros 1 Recent renovation great style 2 Great location 3 House car to take you to dinner 4 Valets were great guys Cons 1 The minibar was never refreshed from Monday onwards on a Monday to Friday stay. Even after I asked. 2 Front desk people did not say hello or acknowledge us when we came in or left each day or night 3 Pool service drinks were empty for 30 minutes the waiter would look around and not offer refills. Polside for 2 hours saw the waiter twice 4 They were filming stuff and did not ever say sorry for the interruption please accept our apologies for the inconvenience. The bartender said he could not get our drink because they were filming Seemed like there was nobody in charge. Nobody holding anyone to a standard. These issues could be because they are recently reopened. If so they should tell the customers to expect some service interruptions etc.

Very expensive with extra charges but lovely hotel. It ’s a lovely boutique hotel but very expensive especially when they add a 50 dollar a night resort fee and 50 dollar a night car park fee. We were given a king bed and sofa bed for our family if 5 instead of the two queens and sofa bed we booked. They wanted to charge an extra 200 dollars per NIGHT for a rolaway bed. but our 3rd child slept on another couch instead. There was no kitchenette as advertIsed and no coffee tea making as advertised cup of coffee is 8 dollars a time. Service is patchy. lovely pool and loungers. Gorgeous decor.

Stunning ocean front boutique hotel perfect location and fantastic decor. Perfect location with stunning ocean views and short stroll to the beach. Beautiful decor huge beds and dangerously tempting mini bar. Staff all fantastic with lovely breakfasts. Also great history as it is where Stan Laurel lived before it was converted to a hotel. Room temperature and lights controlled by iPad. All very cool and trendy but just a bit fidly especially after you have raided the mini bar.
